content: tina cowl __________________________________________________________________________________________________ marny kindness designs supermarno on ravelry and instagram tina cowl is inspired by the tv show the bear tina is one of my favorite characters and i was so moved by her in the episode called napkins where she wore this hand knit cowl i looked online and did a google image search but couldn t find anything specific ravelry had forums trying to re-engineer it i had to figure it out i went to a miss babs trunk show at skein yarn shop in east greenwich ri and found this color right away it was meant to be knit in the round inside out this cowl is reversible and can be worn either way i hope that liza colón-zayas feels the love of all her fans 1 yarn gauge 1 skein approx 350 yards/320 meters total of worsted weight 19 s�tches in the round = 4 /10cm on size us 9/5 5mm needle yarn knit in miss babs big silk color harvest plenty or size needed to obtain gauge needles no�ons size us 9/5 5mm needle or size needed to obtain gauge s�tch markers scissors tapestry needle to weave in ends techniques abbrevia�ons k - knit long tail cast on p - purl knit sts - s�tches purl pm - place marker sm - slip marker pa�ern instruc�ons using long tail cast on method cast on 168 sts rib *k2 p2* for 2 body *k10 p4* to end of round repeat un�l 10 from cast on edge rib *k2 p2* for 2 bind off loosely turn inside out cowl can be worn both ways photo credit fx on hulu screenshot from episode napkins season 3 cleaning and care - cold water hand wash with wool soap like soak lay flat to air dry share your photos on ravelry and on instagram using #marnykindnessdesigns tag me at @supermarno 2024 copyright pattern and images - marny kindness 2
